page.title: 05FARMING IN SHERIFFHALES
page.content: Slaters farm in Sheriffhales is a dairy farm but there are a few beef cattle.The land covers 600 acres and is used for growing wheat, barley, sugarbeet and rye grass.The Rye grass is regrown every 5 years, because of grass and other crops getting mixed in with it.The grass is cut twice a year with a 6 week gap inbetween. The brown and white cattle that are kept at the farm are Ayrshires and there are 140 of them. The milk gets sucked out of the cows through some pipes and into a big metal tank which keeps the milk cold. Each cow gives 3 gallons a day and 1200 gallons of milk in a year. The place where the silage is stored is quite a long way from where the milking takes place. It is stored in an area with concrete walls cutting it off from the rest of the farm.
